section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 15. Pregnancy, Childbirth, and the Puerperium > k. Puerperal sepsis

content.full_text: Code O85, Puerperal sepsis, should be assigned with a secondary code to identify the causal organism (e.g., for a bacterial infection, assign a code from category B95-B96, Bacterial infections in conditions classified elsewhere). A code from category A40, Streptococcal sepsis, or A41, Other sepsis, should not be used for puerperal sepsis. If applicable, use additional codes to identify severe sepsis (R65.2-) and any associated acute organ dysfunction. Code O85 should not be assigned for sepsis following an obstetrical procedure (See Section I.C.1.d.5.b., Sepsis due to a postprocedural infection). (Evidence: pg no: 68, L43-L49)
content.summary: Specific coding guidelines for puerperal sepsis including organism identification, code exclusions, and procedure-related sepsis distinctions (Evidence: pg no: 68, L43-L49)
key_concepts: O85 requires secondary organism code (Evidence: pg no: 68, L43-L44)
A40 and A41 codes excluded for puerperal sepsis (Evidence: pg no: 68, L44-L45)
Severe sepsis coding applies (Evidence: pg no: 68, L45)
Postprocedural sepsis coded differently (Evidence: pg no: 68, L48-L49)

detailed_rules.rule_text: O85 should be assigned with secondary code to identify causal organism (Evidence: pg no: 68, L43-L44)
detailed_rules.explanation: Puerperal sepsis requires identification of the causative organism using appropriate infection codes (Evidence: pg no: 68, L43-L44)

detailed_rules.rule_text: A40 and A41 codes should not be used for puerperal sepsis (Evidence: pg no: 68, L44-L45)
detailed_rules.explanation: General sepsis codes are excluded when coding puerperal sepsis - use O85 instead (Evidence: pg no: 68, L44-L45)

detailed_rules.rule_text: O85 should not be assigned for sepsis following obstetrical procedure (Evidence: pg no: 68, L48-L49)
detailed_rules.explanation: Sepsis following obstetrical procedures should be coded as postprocedural infection, not puerperal sepsis (Evidence: pg no: 68, L48-L49)

workflow_steps: Step 2: Assign O85 as primary code
Step 3: Add organism identification code (B95-B96 for bacterial)
Step 4: Add R65.2 if severe sepsis present
Step 5: Add organ dysfunction codes if applicable

code_ranges.description: Bacterial infections in conditions classified elsewhere (Evidence: pg no: 68, L44)
usage_rules: Secondary to O85 for bacterial puerperal sepsis (Evidence: pg no: 68, L43-L44)

code_ranges.requirement: Do not use for puerperal sepsis
usage_rules: Excluded for puerperal sepsis coding (Evidence: pg no: 68, L44-L45)

code_ranges.requirement: Do not use for puerperal sepsis
usage_rules: Excluded for puerperal sepsis coding (Evidence: pg no: 68, L44-L45)

code_ranges.description: Severe sepsis codes (Evidence: pg no: 68, L45)
usage_rules: Additional code for severe puerperal sepsis (Evidence: pg no: 68, L45)

code_categories_mentioned: Category B95-B96 - Bacterial infections in conditions classified elsewhere

references_to.title: Sepsis due to a postprocedural infection
references_to.explanation: Referenced for coding sepsis following obstetrical procedures

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient with puerperal sepsis due to Group B Streptococcus
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: 32-year-old female, 5 days postpartum, with puerperal sepsis due to Group B Streptococcus
step_by_step: Step 2: Assign O85 for puerperal sepsis
Step 3: Add B95.1 for Group B Streptococcus
Step 4: Do not use A40.1 (excluded for puerperal sepsis)

correct_coding.rationale: Puerperal sepsis requires O85 with organism identification, not general sepsis codes (Evidence: pg no: 68, L43-L45)

incorrect_coding.rationale: A40 codes should not be used for puerperal sepsis
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using general sepsis codes instead of O85

breakdown.O85: Puerperal sepsis primary code (Evidence: pg no: 68, L43)
breakdown.B95.x: Bacterial organism identification (Evidence: pg no: 68, L44)

examples.rationale: Dual coding required for complete puerperal sepsis documentation (Evidence: pg no: 68, L43-L44)

warnings: Do not use A40 or A41 codes for puerperal sepsis (Evidence: pg no: 68, L44-L45)
Do not use O85 for postprocedural sepsis (Evidence: pg no: 68, L48-L49)
best_practices: Always identify causative organism with secondary code (Evidence: pg no: 68, L43-L44)
Add severe sepsis and organ dysfunction codes when applicable (Evidence: pg no: 68, L45)
tips: Puerperal sepsis has specific coding rules different from general sepsis
Always check if sepsis is postprocedural vs. puerperal
implementation_notes: Applies only to sepsis in puerperium, not procedure-related
clinical_context: Puerperal sepsis occurs in postpartum period
Different from sepsis following obstetrical procedures
